page.title: 01KENTON AND ASPALL, SUFFOLK
page.content: The area is primarily an agricultural one and contains two villages, Kenton (pop 140) and Aspall (pop 40). The land is medium to heavy day and the products include sugar beet, wheat, pigs, beef, rape and apples. There are four moated houses, Aspall House, Aspall Hall (where the Cyder House is), Kenton Hall and Moat Farm, Kenton (where there is an apple orchard run commercially). The only non-agricultural enterprise in the area (excluding the Cyder House) is a food store and distribution centre in Kenton. The workers there do not live in the area and with labour on the farms being even further reduced as the agricultural environment becomes harsher, many of the inhabitants work outside the area. History demands a mention. Blood Hall (sq. 11) is a memory of a battle against the Danes.
